task.title: Install and Configure the Eucalyptus User Console

taskbody.context: In this section of the lab you will install and configure the Eucalyptus User Console. Once you have completed this task, you will start the User Console service.

step.cmd: If necessary, from the Debian desktop open an SSH session to the front-end host.
One the front-end host, use the yum command to install the User Console service.

info.note: The User Console installation depends on the eucalyptus-release.repo and epel.repo files in the /etc/yum.repos.d directory. These files have already been installed on the front-end host as part of the initial Eucalyptus installation.

step.cmd: Open the /etc/eucalyptus-console/console.ini file using either the vi or nano -w editor. Leave the file open for editing.
While in the editor, make the following changes in the console.ini file. All the other default settings will work in the lab environment. Save your changes and close the editor when you are finished.
On the front-end host, start the User Console service.
